newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk TV watchdog warns channels on traffic safety.
newsitem.headline: Turk TV watchdog warns channels on traffic safety.

text.p: Turkey's broadcasting watchdog on Tuesday warned television channels to live up to their legal obligations to improve the country's woeful road safety record.
The Supreme Board of Radio and Television said in a statement it would take "the necessary action" to ensure stations broadcast 30 minutes of road safety information a week.
Turkey has one of the world's highest traffic accident rates. There were 2,161 road deaths in the first six months of 1997, police officials say.

The board, which has the power to force channels off the air temporarily, said some of Turkey's dozen or so national channels were not broadcasting any driver education programmes and others were airing them in the early morning.
